definition: specific to a particular stage (of a project etc)/interim (policy etc)/occurring in stages/phased
paragraph/section/segment/stage (of a process)/classifier for stories, periods of time, lengths of thread etc
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Certain stages and periodicities existed in the variation of water resources.
sentences.chinese: 水资源的变化存在一定的阶段性和周期性。

sentences.english: From the historical perspective, there is a staged meaning that the Nanyue Kingdom explored the Lingnan region.
sentences.chinese: 从历史上看，南越王国对岭南开发有着阶段性的意义。

sentences.english: The ratio of the stillbirth and the early neonatal death de creased one stage by one stage. Conclus…
sentences.chinese: 各阶段死产和早期新生儿死亡比率呈逐阶段性下降。

sentences.english: Ask the boss to give you feedback on your progress from time to time.
sentences.chinese: 要求上司对你的工作进展给予阶段性的反馈。

sentences.english: The growth of Coreius heterodon showed two apparent phases.
sentences.chinese: 铜鱼生长具有明显的阶段性。

sentences.english: Episodes of mania and depression typically recur across the life span.
sentences.chinese: 阶段性的躁狂和抑郁通常在一生中反复发作。

sentences.english: Self- checking regularly is also needed for discovering and correcting error in medical records.
sentences.chinese: 进行阶段性自我检查，发现错处及时纠正。

sentences.english: I hope these bahavior will be fade in future, just a habit in a certain period.
sentences.chinese: 希望这些能慢慢淡化，成为阶段性的习惯。

sentences.english: These mental thoughts are liminal phases.
sentences.chinese: 这些思考是有阶段性的。

sentences.english: International pressure led to periodic crackdowns by Chinese authorities.
sentences.chinese: 迫于国际压力，中国政府部门也曾阶段性地进行打压。

sentences.english: Results The development of colon ENS and colon wall has distinct stages.
sentences.chinese: 结果人胚胎结肠肠神经系统发育有明显的阶段性。

sentences.english: But trading volume and the amount of open positions are at the stage of low.
sentences.chinese: 但成交量和未平仓量都处于阶段性低位。

sentences.english: The university result has stages, and the third or fourth semester is the demarcation point.
sentences.chinese: 大学成绩具有阶段性，第三或者第四学期为分界点。

sentences.english: It is still a brand-new subject that it is studied that the stage of the field project stands in the road transportation.
sentences.chinese: 道路运输站场项目的阶段性研究还是一个全新的课题。

sentences.english: Stage fell into hard cotton rose stage.
sentences.chinese: 棉花陷入阶段性易跌难涨阶段。

sentences.chinese: 各阶段死产和早期新生儿死亡比率呈逐阶段性下降。

definition: to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
turning point/breaking point/inflexion point (math., a point of a curve at which the curvature changes sign)
to shake up/to jolt/to vibrate/to oscillate/to fluctuate
to slow down/to ease up/to abate/slowdown/downturn
to rise again after a fall/to pick up/rally (stock market etc)
market price/quotation of market price/the current market situation
